definition: barbarian/slave servant/(old) contemptuous term for people from southern China (used by northern Chinese people)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: You must be raging and have at least one unused barbarian rage power.
sentences.chinese: 你必需处于狂暴并有最少一项未用的蛮子狂暴威能。

sentences.english: And she thinks Southerners are wild barbarians.
sentences.chinese: 她还把南方人当做蛮子。

sentences.english: Ancient Chinese call their neighboring people as "bugs" or"barbarians".
sentences.chinese: 古代汉族人把他们的邻居称作“虫豸”或“蛮子”。

sentences.english: Barbarian's jumping attack covers quite a distance. Goes flying up staincase.
sentences.chinese: 蛮子的跳斩距离相当的远，落地时仍有震波攻击。

sentences.english: The barbarians defiled the church by using it as a stable.
sentences.chinese: 蛮子通过使用它排成了纵列前进教会作为槽枥。

definition: Bayan (name)/Bayan of the Baarin (1236-1295), Mongol Yuan general under Khubilai Khan, victorious over the Southern Song 1235-1239/Bayan of the Merkid (-1340), Yuan dynasty general and politician
horse thief/(old) group of horse-mounted bandits
Tartar (various northern tribes in ancient China)/Tatar (Turkic ethnic group in central Asia)
prisoner of war/to capture/to take prisoner/(old) northern barbarian/slave
